modules.description: This module defines a button with a string content field and a render function that formats the button as a string, scaled by an integer size. It works with the button type containing textual content. Use this module to generate text-based button representations with adjustable sizing.

This module defines a frame structure with fields for title, image and post extra data, buttons, and an optional input. It provides a `render` function that takes a frame and a string, returning a formatted string representation. Useful for generating UI components in web or terminal interfaces with structured content and interactive elements.

Replaces special characters in strings with their corresponding HTML entities. Works with string inputs containing raw text. Useful for preparing user-generated content for safe display in web applications.

Starts a server that listens on a specified host and port, handling WebSocket connections with a provided frame generator, action processor, and message transformer. It works with strings for network communication, integers for ports, and custom types `Oframl.frame` and `Oframl.action` to represent UI frames and user interactions. This module is used to set up a standalone web server that serves dynamic, interactive web pages using a functional reactive framework.

This module defines a record type representing user interface actions with fields for button index, input text, and form identifier. It provides functions to serialize and deserialize these actions to and from JSON using Yojson. These operations support handling form interactions where input values and user selections need to be encoded or decoded for transmission or storage.

This module implements a functional UI framework for building interactive terminal or web interfaces. It provides structured components like buttons and frames with rendering capabilities, handles user actions through serializable records, and includes a server module to host reactive applications. Key data types include buttons with text content, frames containing structured UI elements, and actions capturing user input for processing or transmission.
